h3.a: How to sign up as a new user?

body.p: You can sign up as a new user wither with a self-issued information card or with user name password based account.
From the home page click on the "Sign-up" under the menu "Identity"

h3.a: How to login to Identity Server as a user?

body.p: You can login WSO2 Identity Server with a registered self-issued information card or with user name password based account.
From the home page click on the "InfoCard/OpenID Sign-in" under the menu "Identity"

h3.a: How to use an external OpenID to log in to Identity Server?

body.p: From the home page click on the "Sign-in" under the menu "Identity"
Once you return back from your OpenID Provider to the Identity Server, you can either create a new account with it or associate that OpenID with an existing user account

h3.a: How to get a Managed Information Card?

body.p: Once you logged in to the Identity Server, you can download a managed information card against your profile.
Click on the "InfoCard/OpenID Dashboard" under the menu "My Identity"

h3.a: How to get an OpenID Information Card?

body.p: Once you logged in to the Identity Server, you can download an OpenID information card against your profile.
Click on the "InfoCard/OpenID Dashboard" under the menu "My Identity"
Once you register with the Identity Server, you are automatically assigned an OpenID.
Click on the "InfoCard/OpenID Dashboard" under the menu "My Identity"

h3.a: How to add a trusted Relying Party?

body.p: Once you logged in to the Identity Server, you can upload the public certificates of the trusted relying parties.
Click on the "Relying Parties" under the menu "My Identity"

h3.a: How to enable XMPP based authentication for OpenIDs?

body.p: Once you logged in to the Identity Server, you can configure to enable XMPP based authentication for OpenIDs.
Click on the "Multifactor Authentication" under the menu "My Identity"
